Hi Brad, thanks for you feedback. We took notes on all your suggestions :spiral_note_pad:

Regarding the bug, we have to clarify our docs, the description of inline is a bit misleading. Text will still break into a new line if there is not enough room to grow.  Let me try to clarify:

*inline*: text elements are laid out _horizontally_, one after the other.
*not inline(default)*: text elements are laid out _vertically_, one after the other. The vertical distance between two sibling text is determined by a predefined margin property.

Hope that helps. We will do better with the docs.

Hi all! I was wondering if there was a way to display a message or tooltip over a disabled button to give a reason as to why the button is disabled? For example, I have a series of buttons on a custom card which open different forms. Certain forms require specific associations and the buttons are disabled if those are missing. I would like to be able to display a short message to show the Sales member which specific association they need to enable the button again. Right now I am conditionally displaying a Text component at the bottom of the card to give the reason but I think a tooltip would look much cleaner.
The Tag component has been updated with a new `inline` prop to allow Tags to be inline within Text components. Thanks again for the feedback Magnus!

Hi Annie,
This is great feedback and thank you for the use case detail. I agree, this is an important UX feature add. We don't have this ability right now - but it is something we are discussing how best to solve. In the meanwhile, our suggestion has been to use the microcopy variant of Text (and I see you're doing something like this right now too). I will make sure to update you as soon as we make any improvements here.

Thanks for your feedback and I have recorded this on our end!
